festival.introText:
Every year, Cheltenham Racecourse opens its gates to Wychwood Festival. Described by Time Out Magazine as ‘an excellent hybrid between the Big Chill, WOMAD and The Cambridge Folk Festival’, Wychwood is a relaxed, family friendly three day festival, that has everything from silent disco’s, to workshops, to comedy.

Add to the mix a huge lineup of music, which in the past has included the likes of The Damned, James, and Doctor and The Medics, and you know you’ve got a great festival lined up.

With The Independent effectively calling it ‘the most homely festival in the world’, there is plenty to enjoy at this super relaxed, family friendly festival.
festival.descriptionText: Get more information about Wychwood Festival 2023 including festival tickets, news, reviews and lineups.

faqs.question: When is Wychwood Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Wychwood Festival takes place on Friday 2nd June - Sunday 4th June 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to Wychwood Festival by coach?
faqs.answer: National Express runs coaches to Cheltenham that arrive at the Royal Well Bus Station. These services are available from most major cities, including Bristol, Birmingham, Cardiff and London. http://www.nationalexpress.com

faqs.question: Does Wychwood Festival have onsite camping?
faqs.answer:
We have 4 wonderful campsites beneath the Prestbury Hills at Wychwood Festival, complete with areas for caravans, campervans and luxury camping options.

 

Facilities for campers include hot showers and a lock-up to store any valuables.

 

Yes, Wychwood Festival's campsites are all located within a short walk from the festival main arena and the whole site is very compact and easy to get around with plenty of flat paths that are ideal for wheelchairs and buggies.

 

To make life easier for our guests, campsite drop-off areas are provided on arrival and departure, so you can drive closer to the campsite to unload before parking your car in the car park.

faqs.question: Accessibility information
faqs.answer: Please visit https://wychwoodfestival.com/accessibility for the most up to date accessibility information for Wychwood Festival.

faqs.question: Where is Wychwood Festival?
faqs.answer: Wychwood Festival is located at Cheltenham Racecourse, Evesham Rd, Cheltenham GL50 4SH.

faqs.question: How do I get to Wychwood Festival by train?
faqs.answer: Cheltenham Spa is the nearest train station. Check out the national rail website http://www.nationalrail.co.uk for times and prices or call 08457 48 49 50. There are direct services from London Paddington, Bristol, Birmingham, Swindon, Cardiff, Plymouth, Manchester, Leeds, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

faqs.question: General Camping
faqs.answer: Right next to the festival main arena, General Camping is for those who are happy to stay up late.

faqs.question: What are the opening hours at Wychwood Festival?
faqs.answer:
Entrance to the campsites will be from 10:00am on Friday. The Festival Village will open at 12 noon on Friday and live music will start shortly after.

 

The Festival Village opens from 9:30am on Saturday and Sunday, with music beginning from 11:00am. Entertainment continues until 3:00am.

 

The campsite will close at midday on the Monday.

faqs.question: How do I get to Wychwood Festival by bus?
faqs.answer:
Buses run regularly from the town centre, the bus station and the railway station direct to the racecourse. Route D runs from the train station passing through the city centre at Clarence St which is within walking distance of the bus station. The bus leaves every 10 minutes during the day and between 10 minutes and every hour in the evenings from Monday to Saturday. The services run hourly on Sundays.

 

https://www.stagecoachbus.com/about/west

faqs.question: Glamping
faqs.answer:
Wychwood Festival have a great range of luxury accommodation starting from as little as £105.63 per person! Treat yourself to one of their boutique camping options for that extra luxury during your time at Wychwood Festival!

 

Visit: https://wychwoodfestival.com/glamping/

faqs.question: How do I get to Wychwood Festival by bike?
faqs.answer: Cycling is a cheap and environmentally friendly way to get to the festival. There are 52 secure bicycle parks next to the Centaur and the Best mate enclosure entrances to the racecourse.

faqs.question: Accessibility Campsite
faqs.answer:
The closest campsite to the festival main arena, this site is reserved for Accessibility ticket holders and offers easy access to accessible toilets and showers.

 

Read more here: https://wychwoodfestival.com/information/accessible-facilities

faqs.question: Where can I find more information for Wychwood Festival?
faqs.answer: Take a look at their official site at https://wychwoodfestival.com/information/faqs for more information.

faqs.question: How do I get to Wychwood Festival by taxi?
faqs.answer:
These are not unreasonably priced if you are carrying a lot of baggage and with some friends. Find a taxi service. A taxi from the centre of Cheltenham to the Racecourse should cost less than £10.

 

Wychwood Festival has partnered with minicabit, the UK cab comparison service, which makes pre-booking a festival cab online really easy.

 

minicabit compares cab fleets across the country to find you the best price—no matter from where you are travelling!

 

Sharing a cab with friends often works out cheaper with up to 16-seater cabs available. Book your return journey too and avoid the end of festival crowds.

 

Early bird special

Get £5 off any prepaid trip over £20, please use promo code: WYCHWOOD

https://www.minicabit.com/wychwood-festival-taxi

faqs.question: Campervan & Caravan Field
faqs.answer:
This is a separate field for campervans and caravans. An additional Campervan Pass is needed to gain access to this field. You are able to have one tent or awning alongside your camper/caravan.

 

Please note: all guests in the campervan/caravan will require a Weekend with camping Ticket.

faqs.question: How do I get to Wychwood Festival by lift share?
faqs.answer:
With the average 100 mile car journey leading to over 20 kg of CO2 being produced, sharing has the potential to reduce the festival’s carbon footprint considerably. We can have a real impact on our carbon footprint if we reduce the amount of car journeys.

 

If sharing a lift remember—safety first:

 

  • Make sure you know the identity of the person or persons you are sharing with.
  • Having the driver’s home telephone number (landline) is sensible precaution and make sure you leave details of the lift share, the driver and passenger’s number(s) and home address if possible with friends and/or family.
  • Take your mobile phone with you.
  • If you are at all uncomfortable with any arrangements, or the condition of the vehicle being used, then make other plans. If a vehicle is not taxed it is quite possible the driver has no driving licence, no insurance and the vehicle is in a poor condition.
  • Safety first: Trust your instincts and use common sense.

faqs.question: Important information on campsite unloading/loading
faqs.answer:
To the benefit of everybody, please adhere to the following:

  • Do not drive on the grass, unless directed by a steward (remember you're staying on a very expensive racecourse and don't wish to damage anything).
  • Follow directions and signage. At peak times there may be a queue to access the drop off areas, please be patient and follow instructions from stewards so we can get everyone in as quickly as possible.
  • Don't take too long. Being respectful of other campers will assist greatly in getting everyone in/out as quickly as possible.

faqs.question: How do I get to Wychwood Festival by car?
faqs.answer:
Situated at junctions 10, 11 and 11a of the M5, Cheltenham lies within the main motorway network in easy reach of London, Bristol and Birmingham. If traveling from the north on the M5 it is possible to leave from junction 9 and take the A435 south. The racecourse can also be reached from the East and West by the A40.

 

Or set your sat-nav to the racecourse’s postcode: GL50 4SH.

faqs.question: Wychwood Festival camping - further information
faqs.answer: Please visit https://wychwoodfestival.com/information/campsite-information for further information on camping at Wychwood Festival.

news.title: Caravan Palace: 'We've got a lot of ideas... but the direction isn't fixed yet'
news.summary: Jasmine Phull catches up with Hugues Payen from supercool French outfit Caravan Palace to talk about their new album 'Panic', forthcoming worldwide tour, and recording sounds 1930's style.

news.title: Wychwood Festival announce Soul II Soul as Friday headliner
news.summary: Soul II Soul have been announced as Friday night headliners at the ninth annual Wychwood Festival, which returns to Cheltenham Racecourse from May 31st to June 2nd.

news.title: Wychwood Festival: more acts announced
news.summary: Kate Nash, Craig Charles and Police Dog Hogan have ben added to the line-up of the 9th annual Wychwood Festival.
